subject: Reiteration on the Ban on the Use of Styrofoam and Plastic Products

quote.text: The greatest threat to our planet is the belief that someone else will save it.
quote.author: Robert Swan

background.ordinance: City of Baguio Ordinance No. 18, s. 2016
background.purpose: To reinforce SLUâ€™s commitment to environmental protection and sustainability

guidelines.rule: Caterers and canteens are NOT allowed to use Styrofoam and plastic products for food packaging and serving.
notes: Bringing personal meal boxes, plates, and utensils is highly encouraged.

guidelines.rule: Bottled water is NOT to be sold in canteens nor served by caterers during events, gatherings, or meetings.
notes: Bringing drinking flasks is highly encouraged.
Drinking fountains are available in designated areas.

guidelines.rule: Employees, students, and visitors are prohibited from bringing Styrofoam or plastic-packaged items into the campus.
Suppliers of laboratory equipment, glassware, gadgets, reagents, etc., that use Styrofoam or plastic for packaging must retrieve and dispose of such materials appropriately.

reminders: Let us actively support our environmental advocacies by practicing the 3Rs: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle.
As stewards of God's creation, let us do our part by using environmentally safe products.

signatory.name: Rev. Fr. Ginbert B. Sales, CICM
signatory.title: President
